instruction: Any PING request destined for 10.0.0.1 should go through port 3.

Ensure UDP packets on destination port 80 addressed to 10.0.0.3 are forwarded via port 2 using queue 1.

In switch 3, assign high-priority queue 2 to video streaming traffic (UDP port 8080) destined for 10.0.0.6 through interface 3.
Forward all ICMP echo replies destined for 10.0.0.2 through port 5 of node 2 for network diagnostics.

Prioritize routing SNMP traffic (UDP port 161) to port 5 using queue 0 of switch 4.

Route HTTP traffic originating from 192.168.1.2 on port 1 of switch 4 and destined for 10.0.0.5/32 through port 2, ensuring packets are assigned to queue 0 for low-latency processing and apply VLAN tag 100.
In switch 3, create a slice for IoT devices. Route MQTT traffic (TCP port 1883) from 192.168.3.10 to 10.0.0.20/32 via port 2 and assign it to queue 1 for high-priority processing.
Using openflow 1, SIP signaling traffic (UDP 5060) coming from 192.168.1.50 (a VoIP server) to 10.0.0.100 (a VoIP client) should be assigned queue 3 for prioritization and forwarded via port 4.
Traffic from port 2 of switch 2 destined for 10.0.0.1 should use interface 4 for passing.
